channel.title: Innovation Now
channel.itunes:subtitle: Innovation Now is a daily 90-second radio series and podcast that gives listeners a front row seat to hear compelling stories of revolutionary ideas, emerging technologies and the people behind the concepts that are shaping our future.
channel.itunes:author: WHRO
channel.itunes:summary: Innovation Now is a daily 90-second radio series and podcast that gives listeners a front row seat to hear compelling stories of revolutionary ideas, emerging technologies and the people behind the concepts that are shaping our future.
channel.description: Innovation Now is a daily 90-second radio series and podcast that gives listeners a front row seat to hear compelling stories of revolutionary ideas, emerging technologies and the people behind the concepts that are shaping our future.
channel.itunes:keywords: innovation, now, NASA, technology, NIA, Aerospace, WHRV, technology

item.title: Driving Hot
item.itunes:author: WHRO
item.description: Formula 1 race teams are looking at a new exhaust system that diverts more of the heat behind their seat, thanks to a NASA polymer.
item.itunes:keywords: innovation, now, technology, NASA, jobs, NIA, radio, spinoff, NOAX, Formula 1 racing, shuttle

item.title: Closing the Communications Gap
item.itunes:author: WHRO
item.description: NASA’s space-based communications system will efficiently close the generation gap, supporting space communications for another 15 years.
item.itunes:keywords: innovation, now, technology, NASA, jobs, NIA, radio, communications, relay, TDRS, space

item.title: Reset Your Clock
item.itunes:author: WHRO
item.description: The re-setting of your biological clock can take as long as two weeks but a new app for smartphones can help dramatically shorten that adjustment period.
item.itunes:keywords: innovation, now, technology, NASA, jobs, NIA, radio, app, biorhythm, circadian rhythm, jet lag, Entrain

item.title: Air Traffic Control
item.itunes:author: WHRO
item.description: A NASA app monitors an aircraft’s current position, altitude, flight route, air traffic, and real-time weather conditions all while searching for routes that can save flight time.
item.itunes:keywords: innovation, now, technology, NASA, jobs, NIA, radio, aeronautic, apps, air traffic, Langley, Centennial

item.title: Cure for a Broken Heart
item.itunes:author: WHRO
item.description: Doctors are using a special glue to patch holes and seal cuts in hearts and heart arteries, without using stitches, or staples of any kind.
item.itunes:keywords: innovation, now, technology, NASA, jobs, NIA, radio, medicine, heart, biofabric, Harvard

item.title: Comet Crunchers
item.itunes:author: WHRO
item.description: This radical design for sampling comets or small asteroids, and returning those samples splits the job for efficiency.
item.itunes:keywords: innovation, now, technology, NASA, jobs, NIA, radio, NIAC, sampling, exploration, comets, Juan Arietta

item.title: Generating Hydrogen
item.itunes:author: WHRO
item.description: A team from Columbia and Harvard Universities are perfecting a catalyst for generating cheap hydrogen, powered by sunlight.
item.itunes:keywords: innovation, now, technology, NASA, jobs, NIA, radio, hydrogen, fuel, solar energy

item.title: ArterioVision
item.itunes:author: WHRO
item.description: Technology that helped us get a good look at Mars is now helping save lives here on Earth!
item.itunes:keywords: innovation, now, NASA, technology, NIA, Aerospace, WHRV, technology, health, medical, ArterioVision, heart, heart disease, testing, preventative
